KCTU Decides to Go on General Strike
articles.content:
KCTU Decides to Go on General Strike 
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a press conference on Sept. 21 and decided to go on a general strike for checking the "government's bill on protecting part-time job", according to south Korea's KBS.
 Referring to the unreasonableness of the bill, the organization held that if the bill is passed through, the all-time jobs of the society will decrease rapidly in a few years. It said that it decided to go on a general strike in late November to check the bill.    
 Accordingly, the south Korean Federation of Metal Industry Trade Unions under the KCTU held a press conference and declared that it will enter a strike right after the government and the ruling party lay a "bill on dispatching working people" before the National Assembly.

New Posters Printed
articles.content:
New Posters Printed 
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House has recently published posters conducive to arousing the working people and youth to the gigantic struggle for building a prosperous country. 
 Posters "Let us become young heroes in the worthwhile struggle to glorify the Songun era!" and "Let us become performers of new miracles and feats and young heroes in building the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station!" ardently call upon the young people across the country to bear deep in mind the pride of being young vanguard of Songun intensely loyal to leader Kim Jong Il and further exalt the honor of the shock brigade and vanguard at difficult and toil-assuming posts of socialist economic construction.    
 A poster "Let's turn our villages into socialist fairyland where crops are abundant!" calls for sprucing up streets, villages and working sites with ardent patriotism and love for native places.

Peaceful Reunification of Korea Supported by Czech President
articles.content:
Peaceful Reunification of Korea Supported by Czech President
    Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- We support the efforts of the Korean people for reunification and hope that Korea would be reunified peacefully.
Czech President Vaclav Klaus said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador e. p. to the Czech Republic Ri Pyong Gap on Tuesday.    
 The president added that the relations between the two countries are now favorably developing and the two countries aspire after the development of the relations and have a brisk exchange of delegations.

articles.title: Total Abolition of SL Urged
articles.content:
Total Abolition of SL Urged
    Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea called for the total abolition of the "Security Law" (SL), the law belonging to the old era, according to south Korean KBS.
 Pak Yong Jin, a spokesman for the party, in a commentary expressed concern over the fact that the Grand National Party and the Uri Party are going to rename the SL in the form of the "substitute legislation" and leave its poisonous articles untouched.    
 This is a sheer deception without any justification, he said, stressing that the total abolition of the SL is the only way of putting the society on a new stage.
